intro: Aplostemon polytrichoides, commonly known as the hairy stemless daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a dense, daisy-like cluster. It has a hairy stem and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Aplostemon polytrichoides is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
